title: Understand the connection being made
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to understand the larger implications of the connection being made so that I will feel confident in connecting with MetaMask and understand the security implications.

**Description**

This story covers the warning text that appears at the bottom of a the connection prompt when connecting to a site.

Designs available for the warning / disclaimer are here: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=752%3A44

**AC**

title: See that I'm not connected to the current site with this account
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to see  that I'm not connected to the current site with this account, so that I will know I that I can initiate a connection on this account or switch to an account that is connected.

**Description**

This story is covers giving a notification to the user if they're connected to a site using an account other than the currently active account.

Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A1728

title: Find a link to a site I'm connected to
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to find a link to a site I'm connected to so that I can recall what that specific dapp is.

**Description**

In the designs, this currently exists as a nested "Go to ____" option when viewing the connected sites modal.

Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A2025

title: See which of my connected accounts is currently selected
body:
As a dapp user with multiple accounts connected to a site, I'd like to see which of my connected accounts is the one that is currently selected, so that I will understand what a site is using.

**Description**

When a user views the list of their accounts, the need to know the connection state of each of their accounts. Our supported states are:

Connected [ie. selected]
Last active [ie. connected but not selected]
Not connected [ie. never been connected]

Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A1985

title: Be alerted about the seriousness of connecting my wallet
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to be alerted about the seriousness of connecting my wallet, so that I won't connect to a site that I don't trust.

**Description**

This is an alert that is displayed before the user actually connects their wallet.

Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=378%3A4528

title: See details of my accounts
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to see the details of my accounts, so that I can make a good decision about which account(s) I'd like to connect.

**Description**

This story covers key identifying information of the account that is shown along side each of the specific accounts. This information includes things like:

Account balance
Account address

Designs available: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=378%3A4527

**AC**

* show account's wallet address (last 4)
* show account balance
* show account nickname
* show last connected
* test coverage

title: Disconnect a site from this account
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to disconnect a site from the current account, so that I can revoke its access from my account.

**Description**

There are many reasons a user may need to disconnect a site, for instance if a site is no longer trusted, or if site is no longer used at all.

Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A2025

**AC**

* Test coverage

title: See where I am in the connection process
Switch to another account I'm connected with
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to be able to switch to a different account that I'm connected with, so that I can switch the the appropriate account for a specific site.

**Description**

There are two places we should implement this:

1. View all connections modal: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A2040
2. On the "Not connected" alerts: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A1728

Designs:

title: Create a new account
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to create a new account for my connection to this site, so that I can keep my interactions with this site separate from my other accounts.

**Description**

When connecting to a site, we can protect the user's privacy by giving them the option to connect this site to a new and unique wallet.

Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=752%3A44

**AC**

title: Manage the permissions related to my connections
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to manage the permissions related to an account, so that I can revoke a site's ability to do something that I don't trust it with.

**Description**

This story is a context menu for managing the permissions of all sites connected to a specific account. This is an MVP iteration. In a future story, we'll be implementing the ability to manage the permissions on a per site basis.

The current designs are located here: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A1969

**AC**

* Test coverage

title: Connect my current account to the current site
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to connect my current account to the current site I'm viewing from within MetaMask, so that I will be able to use MetaMask with that site more easily.

**Description**

If possible, we should allow users to connect to the dapp/site they're currently browsing from within MetaMask. This is slightly different from the pattern that currently exists in the designs, which tell them to go to the site to initiate the connection. In many instances, users are forced to reload the page, or have trouble finding the connect button in the UI of the many different dapps. If we can give a reliable place to initiate a dapp connection, this is a superior experience.

This story needs designs and isn't represented in the designs currently.

**AC**

* Test coverage

title: Be introduced to MetaMask Connect status
body:
As a previous MetaMask user, I'd like to be introduced to the new MetaMask Connect status functionality the first time I log back into MetaMask after updating, so that I will understand where I will go to manage my connections.

**Description**

This is a one-time "coach marks" feature that is display only for users who updated from a previous version of MetaMask. If this isn't possible to implement, we should discuss if this is something we are willing to show to all users.

**AC**

* display only once
*display only when the user updated from a previous version of MM

title: Connect the accounts I've selected
body:
As a dapp user. I'd like to connect the accounts that I've selected, so that I will be able to use them with the site I'm interacting with.

**Description**

This story covers the action of actually connecting the accounts that were previously selected.

Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=378%3A4528

title: See all of the sites connected to this account
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to see all of the sites connected to the current account, so that I will remember what I'm using this account for.

**Description**

This story covers the viewing of all connected sites to the single account the user was viewing.

Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A2072

title: Cancel my connection
See whether my current account is connected to the current dapp
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to see whether my current account is connected to the current site, so that I can know whether I will be able to interact with the site I'm viewing.

**Description**

This story cover the status indicator for connection status of an account. Additionally, a user can click on a status indicator to see more details about what it means that an account is or isn't connected.

Designs: 

https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A1690

https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=1273%3A1689

**AC**

* Test coverage

title: Select multiple accounts
body:
As a dapp user, I'd like to be able to select multiple accounts, so that I will be able to connect them.

**Description**

This is the ability to select an account(s) when connecting to a dapp.

Designs are currently available here: https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=752%3A44

**AC**

* Select all option
* select individual options
* Reusable component in the design system

title: See my accounts
body:
As a dapp user signing into a new service, I'd like to see my accounts listed, so that I know what accounts that I will be able to connect to.

**Description**

This story covers the listing / viewing of all of the accounts that I'll be able to connect to when connection.

Designs available here:     https://www.figma.com/file/CvD7nhQVeSEB1QuSy3XhtY/oCap-%2F-Login-Per-Site?node-id=752%3A44

**AC**

title: add version to metrics events
body: to allow us to group events by version

title: Trying to send arbitrary hex encoded data string with transaction fails
body:
Steps to reproduce
```
web3.eth.createTransaction({
...
data: "0x6869"
})
```
Expected result-
The data should be sent along with the transaction.

Actual outcome-
```
code: -32603, message: "Error: [ethjs-rpc] rpc error with payload {"id":59…method":"eth_sendRawTransaction"} [object Object]", stack: "Error: Error: [ethjs-rpc] rpc error with payload {…method":"eth_sendRawTransaction"} [object Object]"}
code: -32603
```

title: Setting a custom Network and trying to send freezes all buttons
body: **Describe the bug** If you set a Custom RPC to use a different Network, like: Network name: xDai Chain New RPC URL: https://dai.poa.network ChainID: 100 Symbol: XDAI Block explorer: https://blockscout.com/poa/xdai/ The balance of the native token in that Network appears correctly, but if you click SEND the interface (e.g. while in expanded view) freezes and all buttons stop working. A blank window issue also arises (could help debug #4894 ?), hence the need to use the expanded view after a few tries. **To Reproduce (REQUIRED)** 1. Add the custom network shown above 2. Resolve the blank window issue by using the expanded view () or re-opening the browser several times. 3. See the balance update correctly 4. Click the SEND button to see error **Expected behaviour** A clear description of what you expected to happen. **Browser details (please complete the following information):** - OS: OS X - Browser: Chrome Version 82.0.4052.0 (Build oficial) canary (64 bits) - MetaMask Version 7.7.2 **Screenshots** This is what appears in the Console right after clicking the SEND button, which does nothing and freezes all other buttons in the expanded view (all except the circle profile picture button in the top-right).

title: Improve confirmation screen error handling
body:
**What problem are you trying to solve?**
We don't currently have a great way of dealing with unrecoverable errors that occur on a confirmation screen. Currently if an expected error occurs, the confirmation screen might either display no indication something went wrong, or it might close, or it might show the top-level error page (if the error occurred during the render). 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
We should catch any unrecoverable errors, log them to Sentry if appropriate, then show the user a message explaining that something went wrong. We should also make clear whether or not the thing they were confirming has been rejected or not.

**Additional context**
I stumbled on this problem while reviewing #7831 , but the problem definitely exists on the signature request UI as well, and probably others too.

title: Set custom gas fee for cancel transaction
body:
**What problem are you trying to solve?**

Ethereum account was stuck with multiple pending transactions using 1 gwei gas fee. The mainnet since then jumped up to 2 - 5 gas fee on average.

When I try to cancel using MetaMask it seems to set the current gas fee only a little bit higher than the original fee, not enough to cancel the original transaction quickly enough. For example it set it to around 1.1 or 1.2 gwei instead, so my cancel tx is not being processed.

I was actually completely unable to cancel my original tx even using MyEtherWallet.com or Mycrypto.com, when I chose a custom nonce there (same as original tx i want to cancel) it seemed to not respect that and MetaMask instead used a new nonce.

So either the gas fee was too low cancelling just via MetaMask, or the nonce was not correct when using external wallet user interfaces like MyEtherWallet.

A similar problem seems to be happening with the "Speed up" feature in MetaMask, I can also not choose the gas fee. What I am currently doing is speeding up the same tx like 10 times to finally get from 1 gwei original gas cost up to 3 and more gwei so that my tx actually gets processed when the network is busy.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Simple input field to set custom gas fee instead of just "Yes" and "No". Could only show up when choosing "Advanced gas controls" in advanced settings.

**Additional context**

Need to be able to set custom (higher) gas fee here:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2923/74008360-a0aa1800-494e-11ea-859a-803522211a33.png)

title: Firefox security key message pop up flickers when interacting with hardware wallets
body:
<!--
BEFORE SUBMITTING:
1) Please search to make sure this issue has not been opened already
2) If this is a implementation question or trouble with your personal project, please post on StackExchange. This will get your question answered more quickly and make it easier for other devs to find the answer in the future.
-->

**Describe the bug**
A message blinks multiple times on Firefox whenever interacting with a hardware wallet on Firefox, through MetaMask.

**To Reproduce (REQUIRED)**
Plug in a hardware wallet, Trezor or Ledger, click Connect Hardware Wallet.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16330048/73977725-788bcc00-48f0-11ea-8d4d-43b0b6bfd7ae.png)

The connection still works, but the popup is distracting and some think it is not working and stop proceeding.

**Expected behavior**
Firefox on Windows has a similar but slightly different popup message.  

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Browser details (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Mac OSX (and it appears to occur on windows too)
 - Hardware Wallet Ledger Nano
 - Browser Firefox
 - MetaMask Version 7.7.4

title: Metamask Transaction Failed with Gaz But Still Charge The Cost Of Gaz
body: **Describe the bug** Hi, If i want to send DAI to Coinbase, the transaction is failing but still charge the amount of gaz. I am able to receive ETH from Coinbase but not send DAI I have Gaz and it say i don't. It does still charge me each time. I tried over 5 time. With different speed also. Even tried to change Advance option, but they just don't work at all. I did remove extension, re-install it. Still the same. . **To Reproduce (REQUIRED)** Steps to reproduce the behavior, libraries used with version number, and/or any setup information to easily reproduce: 1. Go to Wallet and send DAI to Coinbase 2. Click on transaction speed, either Slow, Medium or Fast 3. Click Send 4. See error, Failed Transaction **Expected behavior** A clear description of what you expected to happen. **Screenshots** ![faillll](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55941045/73966002-33ad6880-48e3-11ea-9aa4-3851046ae907.png) ![Sans titremetks](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55941045/73966018-38721c80-48e3-11ea-8fd4-fd08f9734eb4.png) ![Sans titre](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55941045/73966026-3a3be000-48e3-11ea-88f0-30d35cb0f0e2.png) **Browser details (please complete the following information):** - OS: Windows 10, 1909 18363.592 - Hardware Wallet Metamask 7.7.4 - Browser Version 82.0.4050.0 (Build officiel) canary (64 bits) - MetaMask Version 7.7.4

title: update state in selectors and actions tests to match the current state
body:
will help insure that we don't introduce any regressions in the gaba migration
`selectors.spec.js` 
`actions.spec.js`

title: Memo/note/comment for transactions
body:
**What problem are you trying to solve?**
When I look at my tx list, remembering what's what is very confusing/hard/impossible

**Describe the solution you'd like**
On each transaction prompts, a note/memo field you can save, so when you look through the list, you know what's what

title: Move docs to user-facing site

labels.name: L05-documentation
labels.description: Issues relating to documentation, in the codebase and off.

body: The useful contents of the [`docs/`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/tree/develop/docs) directory should be moved to the user-facing docs site under a "Contributing to MetaMask" section (or similar).

title: Checksum addresses internally
body: part of the migration of the preferences controller to gaba (typescript)
